results.title: Orpheus
results.brief_description: A compelling cinematic allegory of the haunting legend of Eurydice and Orpheus set in modern times, with poet Marais encountering The Princess of Death. Orpheus was allowed to reclaim his dead lover on the condition he did not look back upon her face. But he does … An unforgettable experience of true love, with beautiful music and poetic cinematic effects. Rated: M

results.title: Orphee et Eurydice
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, Stefanos Lazaridis, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Orphee et Eurydice, directed by Stefanos Lazaridis, music by Christoph Willibald Gluck, libretto by Ranierie da Calzabigi, and adapted for the French performing edition by Pierre-Louis Moline, tells the tale of lovers separated by death. Orphee must go on a quest to Hades to find his dead wife Eurydice and bring her back to the living. The voyage is full of peril, and it is only after much heartache that he is reunited with his own true love. Features singers David Hobson (Orphee), Miriam Gormley (L’Amour), Amanda Thane (Eurydice), and The Australian Opera Chorus. Also features the Dancers of the Meryl Tankard Australian Dance Theatre and Dancers of The Australian Opera choreographed by Meryl Tankard, and The Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra conducted by Marco Guidarini. Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 20 September 1993 and produced for television in association with the Australian Broadcasting Corporation. Sung in French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Butler, Stefanos Lazaridis, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Opera Australia

results.title: Orphee
results.creator_credit: Jean Cocteau, Andre Paulve and Les Films du Palais Royal
results.brief_description: Cocteau’s updating of the Orpheus legend which haunted his own life takes the poet (Jean Marais), from contemporary Paris to a mysterious chateau ruled by an imperious Princess (Maria Casares), who first claims a younger poet, then Orpheus’ wife, Eurydice. With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Cast also includes Francois Perier, Juliette Greco. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Orlando
results.creator_credit: Sally Potter, Christopher Sheppard, Sigma Film Productions, Rio, Mikado Film Srl (Rome), Lenfilm and Adventure Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Virginia Woolf’s novel, Sally Potter, directing her first feature, has made a ravishing film translation of one of the twentieth century’s most controversial books. The story travels across time and gender as Orlando, who begins life as a young Elizabethan aristocrat, lives through many centuries without ageing, and changing sex in the process. Tilda Swinton is utterly convincing as the young man/young woman who finally becomes one with her inner self and finds freedom as her material inheritance is lost. The film’s music and opulent ‘look’ make this one of recent cinema’s most rewarding experiences.

results.title: Organelles in living plant cells
results.brief_description: Shows the appearance and behaviour of all organelles that can be resolved by the phase and dark-field microscope, such as nuclei, chloroplasts, golgi bodies and kinoplasm. Discloses the interactions between the organelles and cytoplasmic network. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Daughters of the dust [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Julie Dash, Geechee Girls Production, WMG and American Playhouse Theatrical Films
results.brief_description: At the turn of the century the Peazant family, a multigenerational community threatened with break-up, gathers for a reunion on an island off the coast of South Carolina, historically a place of entry for the European slave ships and a haven for self-emancipated Africans and indigenous peoples. Structured around the twin narratives of Nana, born into slavery, and that of the Unborn Child, this is a rites-of-passage story invoking Islam, Christianity and West African spiritual customs. It is not narrative-driven in the Western mode but is balletic, operatic, non-linear and based on the African oral tradition of the Griot (story-teller), drawing on the Gullah dialect. Dash was also inspired by the literature of African-American women writers. Cast includes Adisa Anderson, Cora Lee Day, Alva Rogers, Barbara-0 and Trula Hoosier.

results.title: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres
results.creator_credit: Harry Kumel, Paul Collet, Henry Lange, Maya Films and Showking Films
results.brief_description: In the lost space of an opulent Ostend hotel, eerily deserted in the off season, a young but hardly innocent couple on their honeymoon encounter the apparently ageless, sunlight-fearing, lesbian Countess Bathory. Kumel imaginatively balances the erotic malaise and violence of vampire folklore and a European (specifically Belgian) surrealist tradition with thirties Hollywood camp and comic strip tableaux. Perverse sexuality is located in a setting of decadent highlife which seems to immobilise the “victims”. Originally titled “La Rogue aux Levres” (Lips of Blood). Cast includes John Karlen, Delphine Seyrig, Danielle Ouimet and Andrea Rau.

results.title: Date of birth
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A tribute to the older worker’s high standard of dependability and productivity, and a plea to employers to remove age barriers in hiring new staff. The bitter disappointment felt by an able man denied work because he is over forty-five is expressed in a brief dramatic sequence, and then the film presents the actual record of employees in this age group, reminding us that there is less absenteeism, a lower turnover rate and an equal standard of production among older workers. The importance to the whole country of giving a fair chance to workers over forty-five years of age is explained, and ways in which their problem is being tackled are described.

results.title: Data for decision
results.creator_credit: David Millar, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A look at the ‘Canada Land Inventory Geo-information System’, a computer system used to help manage and develop Canadian land. Shows the computer’s capacity for storing information, correlating and interpreting facts, and converting data into maps and diagrams. Photographed by Martin Duckworth, Jacques Foges and Kjeld Nielsen; animation by Donald Stearn; edited by Arthur Lipsett; sound by Sidney Pearson and George Croll; narrated by Richard Gilbert.
